messages.subject: Re: Like the idea of hell?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Okay, but at least assure me he got a room with a REALLY crappy view and I ll still speak to you. On a serious note, I m sure there are people who would
messages.messageBody:
----------
>From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2535
>Date: Wed, Oct 23, 2002, 4:35 PM
>

> And, although this will piss some people off, Hitler did go to heaven
> because that is the only
> option.


Okay, but at least assure me he got a room with a REALLY crappy view and
I'll still speak to you.

On a serious note, I'm sure there are people who would get pissed. Can't
think why, as it's anybody's guess (or faith, which comes to the same thing)
what happens "after". It's boring (to me) when people start insisting they
"know". That's probably why I have avoided 99.9% of the religious debate
here -- a catastrophic lack of fascination on the subject. ;)

The only interest I have is in seeing that all homeschooling isn't
overshadowed (in the media, in the public, in their own minds) by
Fundamentalist Christian homeschoolers. I don't have the same worries about
Jewish or Buddhist or Pagan homeschoolers, because there aren't (that I'm
aware) organized, large, well-funded groups of them striving to be the
mouthpiece for All Homeschoolingdom a la Harris and H$LDA.

And that's about all I have to say about that.

Pam "Forrest" Hartley
